name: Johnny
appearance: A physically fit man with a rugged outdoorsman look, accustomed to hunting and physical activity.
personality: Hot-tempered, possessive, impulsive, easily angered when provoked, especially regarding romantic rivals.
background: A hunting enthusiast who has long harbored romantic feelings for Helen. He resents Vito, believing himself no inferior. After arranging a date with Helen at a bar to confess his feelings, Johnny got into a violent altercation with Philip, who was harassing her. Although Johnny drove Philip off, the interruption ruined his chance to confess, and Helen left early, leaving Johnny furious and frustrated.
secrets: His growing jealousy and anger could push him toward reckless or violent actions

clues.clueText: Johnny violently confronted Philip at the bar for harassing Helen.

relationships.description: Johnny is deeply infatuated with Helen and wants to confess his feelings.
relationships.history: He has admired her for a long time but has never successfully expressed his love.

relationships.description: Johnny resents Vito for being in a relationship with Helen.
relationships.history: Johnny believes he is no worse than Vito and feels unfairly overlooked.

relationships.description: Philip was beaten by Johnny after harassing Helen.
relationships.history: Their conflict began during a bar confrontation.

notes: Johnny’s emotional volatility makes him a potential wildcard who could escalate situations unexpectedly.
